page.title: 03LIFEBOAT SERVICE SEAHOUSES
page.content: Seahouses Lifeboat Station was opened in 1827. The present station has two boats. The main boat is a self_righting, 37 foot "Oakley" class capable of 8 Knots and a range of 165 nautical miles. The boat ,"The Edward & Mary Lester" was built in 1966 and is manned by a crew of seven and can be launched at any state of the tide in about 15 minutes. The smaller boat is a "D." Class, 16 feet Inflatable inshore rescue boat with a top speed of 20 knots but is only suitable in moderate seas. The nearest boat to the North is at Berwick on Tweed and to the South at Craster. The Coxswain is Mr.Douggie Douglas and there are 24 part time, voluntary lifeboatmen.
